item.title: Wooden waste and shopping trolley left beside 21 Stanstead Close, 29th July
item.description:
Someone has left wooden waste outside (or rather at the back of) my property at 21 Stanstead Close), and someone else has dumped a shopping trolley by Barnhill Avenue. Both are very close and shown on the same photo. Also someone has left metal waste on the left hand side of the entrance to Stanstead Close, just by road sign saying "Stanstead Close".

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnhill Avenue, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive flytip of commercial waste, 29th July
item.description:
I donâ€™t need to tell you this but the fly tipping situation in SE20 is literally out of control. There are now several commercial scale fly tips on an almost daily basis. These are being perpetrated by the same people who I assume are being paid to remove household rubbish and building waste to then dump it publicly. I appreciate it is hard to catch these people but given it is occurring in the same 5-6 spots is it not feasible to install some CCTV. The cost and effort could be easily recovered through a fine? It seems madness to reactively clean up after these crooks only once members of the public report them. The social contract is broken unless you try and proactively stop these criminals.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
